quote: the world needs to see this

quote: I'm completely hooked on @clawdbot. So far I've integrated my emails, home assistant, homelab via SSH, todo list and Apple Notes, our shopping list. All reachable via a single Telegram chat.

quote: Seeing how extraordinarily this works with @clawdbot I kinda want to interact everything like this
author: marcelpociot

quote: I setup autonomous Claude Code loops controlled from my phone. Send 'ralph ~/proj fix tests' via Telegram. Clawdbot matches the skill, runs the loop, sends progress every 5 iterations
author: php100

quote: I've had @clawdbot going for less than 24 hours now, so far it has: cleaned up our Linear issues, wrote several decent email follow-ups, opened 3 PRs, prospected our new signups for the day.
author: avi_press

quote: clawdbot is incredibly well-made, doesn't feel like slop, has elegant docs, and serves us even better than poke
author: atzydev

quote: good lord @clawdbot is so good. within an hour of spinning it up, i had it monitoring my full integration and release workflow, watching the gh action, npm publish, etc end to end and alerting me when done!
author: shuv1337

quote: I don't fall in love easily, but playing with @clawdbot today has been incredibly refreshing. It processed our entire source of truth by simply dumping text files into WhatsApp and responded in minutes, where RAG agents have struggled for days.
author: pocarles

quote: Clawdbot offered to build its own tooling then set everything up itself
author: stevecaldwell

quote: I wanted to keep track of interesting ideas and have Claude explore them in the background. Told @clawdbot to create a process and write docs. Then sent it an idea. And it just worked!
author: andrewjiang
